page.title: 03WRINGTON: RESIDENT INTERVIEW
page.content:
{WRINGTON}IS A GROWING RURAL VILLAGE SITUATED APPROXIMATELY TEN MILES FROM BRISTOL WITH A FRIENDLY,CLOSE COMMUNITY OF 3-4000 PEOPLE,OF WHICH 80-90 ARE CHILDREN. IT HAS ITS OWN JUNIOR SCHOOL BUT SENIOR STUDENTS MUST TRAVEL TO { {CHURCHILL}COMPREHENSIVE,ABOUT 4 MILES AWAY. THERE ARE VARIOUS FUNCTIONS AIMED AT THE OLDER GENERATION BUT THERE IS ALSO A YOUTH CLUB. SHOPPING FACILITIES MODERATE AND VARIED,BUT PRICES ARE HIGH.THE NEAREST LARGE SHOPPING PRECINCT IS 7 MILES AWAY AT{WORLE}BUT BUS SERVICES ARE THE ONLY PUBLIC TRANSPORT AND RUN INFREQUENTLY.THE COMMUNITY RUNS A MINIBUS TO AID PEOPLE WITHOUT TRANSPORT.
CONTINUED ON PAGE 4
